text: The Registration module acts as an interface between the police and citizens and it eases the approach, interaction and information exchange between police and complainants.
Interfacing with the courts during the prosecution of cases is an integral part of the responsibilities of police personnel.
It also gives the user the ability to customize the results view by criminal/accused or by cases.
It makes reporting easy for police by enabling them to execute different types of queries such as monthly reporting, RTI related etc.
The Navigation module of the CCTNS provides role based landing pages which help in navigating through the CCTNS application.
The solution should enable the help-desk user to view the reports on the submitted defects or enhancement requests category-wise, status-wise, and agewise.
The word “unalterable” is to mean that the audit trail data cannot be modified in any way or deleted by any user.
The System must be able to export audit trails for specified cases (without affecting the audit trail stored by the System).
The System must at a minimum be able to provide reports for actions on cases organised.
The System should allow a user to stipulate which other users or groups can access cases.
If a user performs a quick or advanced search, the System must never include in the search result list any record which the user does not have the right to access.
Customer: A customer is an individual wishing to purchase inventory from GAMMA-J’s Web Store.
Shall install online help for users via the web interface.
Shall deliver Operations and Maintenance manual, Users Guide book, and Installation Instructions for the Administrator.
Customers will be able to create accounts to store their customer profiles, configure contact information, view their purchase history, and confirm orders.
Customers will be able to register, log in, and log out of their accounts.
Furthermore, Customer profiles will also include payment information, such as the ability to store credit card information, and address information.

Products will be stored in multi-tiered categories; a category can contain sub categories or products. The inventory management will allow for administrators to update the categories, the products placed in categories, and the specific product details.
The customer will also be able to add to or remove products from the shopping cart prior to checkout and order confirmation.
The WebOrder system shall send an e-mail confirmation to the customer that the items they ordered will be delivered to the shipping address along with tracking number.
The WebOrder system shall send an e-mail to System Administrator regarding any technical queries from customers or sales people.
University administrator and IT Administrators have the control on the entire inventory
Inter departments: request must be approved by a DA group member and faculty group member unless it came from a higher level group
Inter faculties transfer: request can be made by any authorised user and approved by faculty group or higher level
Transfer outside university should be approved by the university group
Any faculty member can add all related departments inventory
A bulk entry can be used to add many assets
There is one heating and cooling unit that corresponds to one thermostat in each of four quadrants on each of three floors of the office building.
The list of un-started games that the MultiMahjongClient fetches from the MultiMahjongServer will be displayed in such a way that users can see the following information about each game.
The MultiMahjongClient will retrieve other players' changes in the game situation from the MultiMahjongServer.

If the configurations of: the current discard, the tiles in a user's hand, and the player whose turn it is, would allow the user to Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong under the Chinese rules of Mahjong, the MultiMahjongClient will inform the user that they can do so.
The TCS shall have the functionality to allow the operator to generate a UAV mission plan.
The TCS shall allow the Operator to fully control the VCR via the TCS Display input device.
Client authentication ensures that an authorised client/operator is operating the equipment.
Basically the communication system must assist the operators, users and other interested parties in performing their tasks by provision of services.
Control function allows an operator or an automatic function to operate equipment like switchgear or transformer, a protection, etc.
ASPERA-3 and MEX OA IDFS data and any APAF-generated intermediate files of ASPERA-3 and MEX OA cleaned-up telemetry shall be provided to all ASPERA-3 Co-I’s.
SwRI shall provide IDFS data processing algorithms to IRF.
The Configure/Editors menu item shall provide an interface for the user to enter editor configuration information.
The View/Select Text menu item shall provide an interface for selecting pretty-printed text or text strings associated with SDT displays.
When a user selects the File/Edit menu item, the HATS-GUI shall request that the operating system start a process and load that process with the editor specified by the application configuration.
When a user selects the File/Delete menu item, the HATS-GUI shall prompt the user to confirm the deletion operation.
The user shall be able to select an arbitrary set of displayed nodes in a displayed graph.
The HATS-GUI shall provide for repeating a search.
The user shall be prompted to enter a text string describing a string pattern.
The HATS-GUI shall not halt as a result of any error messages received from HATS-SML.

The minimal requirements are that the cluster user would be able to interact with the system through the Linux command prompt, or through the interface provided by the Sun Grid Engine cluster management system.
Claire will be assured that the students will know what to do from this main screen.
All users of the system shall login using some form of unique identification.
The administrator shall have the ability to create and add a new user to the system.
AgentMom shall support the ability to send unicast message.
The system must allow a member of the network to send a bulk request on all or a large part of its driver’s smart card holders to a particular or all members of the network.
Quotation is sent by the Sales Point (Seller) to Originator (Buyer) to inform the Buyer of the terms and conditions under which the Seller is willing or able to supply goods or services.
PO (Purchase Order) Response is sent by the Sales Point (Seller) to inform the Order Point (Buyer) of the intention to supply goods or perform services in response to a Purchase Order.
Users can select to share specific objects with other users.
The system shall allow the user to change the project details for unlocked projects.
Auditor, Person appointed to manage County business by a majority vote of District Judges that have jurisdiction in the County.
Commissioners Court,The governing body of the County.
Office of Attorney Appointments receives/reviews the Request for Appointed Counsel.
The application provides a list where the end-user can choose the new status.
The RLCS Application will also allow for remote access through a firewall via outside telecommunications networks by authorized users.
Ability to export data from a project to an XML file so multiple project managers can use that data
Ability to save the current version of the repository so that we can do evolution analysis
Ability to update personal profile such as name, ID, contact information, usergroups and passwords
The system shall allow analysts to view scenarios associated with individual scenarios.
The system shall provide a way to capture the mined goalsinformation from the user’s privacy preferences into a database corresponding to the user’s privacy preferences.
The system shall generate an access log for every add, delete and edit action in the system.
The Clarus system shall minimize the time for data acquisition.
The Clarus system shall apply appropriate quality checks based on the completeness of received sensor station metadata.
The Clarus system shall be able to base its quality control process on values from multiple observations.
The Clarus system shall be able to base its quality control process on historical environmental data.
The Clarus system shall minimize the time for data dissemination.
The Clarus system shall maintain a dynamic library of data for at least seven days.
The Clarus system shall not require approval to request environmental data.
The Clarus system shall enable system administrators to manage security groups.
The Clarus system shall be able to restrict environmental data publication based on source.
The Clarus system baseline data types shall be defined by the NTCIP ESS 1204 standard for data collection.
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate atmospheric metadata.
The Clarus system shall accept only observations that include location, timeframe, and source metadata.
The Clarus system shall accept data through a Clarus standard interface.
The Clarus system shall be able to communicate with an individual ESS through its native interface.
The Clarus system shall transfer data as efficiently as possible.
The Clarus system shall be able to be hosted at one or more physical locations.
The Clarus system shall use software that implements industry accepted standard interfaces.
The Clarus system shall be able to notify subscribers when data sets become available.
The Clarus system shall support 470 million current observations.
The Clarus system shall be able to receive all reported environmental data during a fifteen minute time interval.
The Clarus program standards shall accommodate contributions of new sensor technologies to the Clarus system.
The application should be intuitive and not require any specialist training.
Users shall only be allowed to set daily reminders for themselves.
Systems supporting OM must provide the ability to publish investigationspecific questionnaires and implementation guides.
Systems supporting OM should track the changes made to the status of case records as a result of changes in the case definition.
The user shall be able to switch between predefined structure lists.
The user shall be able to switch between predefined project lists.
The user shall be able to find projects by project ID, project name, project status, structure ID, and program.
The system shall be capable of creating cost and deterioration elicitation records for Pontis users.
The system shall be capable of updating preservation action costs based on expert elicitations.
The system shall provide user interface for managing application roles.
The user shall be able to modify his or her basic account profile.
The system shall be capable of validating user name and password during log-in process.
The system shall be capable of running concurrent sessions for a user.
Provide hierarchical model for managing the archived information.
Browse, visualize, and download agricultural modeling data and results
The system shall provide browsing options to see product details.
The system shall enable user to select multiple options on the screen to search.
The system shall display only 10 matching result on the current screen.
The system shall enable user to navigate between the search results.
The system shall authenticate user credentials to view the profile.
The system shall display both the active and completed order history in the customer profile.
The system shall allow user to select the support type he wants.
The system shall display the online help upon request.
The system shall display the FAQ’s upon request.
The system shall maintain customer email information as a required part of customer profile.
The system shall send an order confirmation to the user through email.
The system shall display different shipping options provided by shipping department.
The system shall display the shipping charges.
The system shall display the current tracking information about the order.
The system shall display the orders that are eligible to change.
The system shall allow user to view detailed sitemap.
The system shall allow user to confirm the purchase.
The system shall provide for replication of databases to off-site storage locations.
The system shall provide RAID V Disk Stripping on all database storage disks.
The product shall take initial load time depending on internet connection strength which also depends on the media from which the product is run.
The system shall automatically log out all customers after a period of inactivity.
The composition of call groups shall be able to be modified within the network. A single user shall be able to be a member of one or more call groups.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from the Chrysler Fast Feedback (telematics demonstration) fleet using the Chrysler telematics interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from Southeast Michigan Snow and Ice Management (SEMSIM) using the SEMSIM interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from Ann Arbor Transit using the Ann Arbor Transit interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from Detroit Department of Transportation (DDOT) Transit using the DDOT interface.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect weather data.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect weather data from Michigan Department of Natural Resources (MDNR) weather information systems using the MDNR interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect weather data from MDOT Aeronautics Automated Weather Observing System (AWOS) using the AWOS interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect traffic data from the Detroit TMC system using the Detroit TMC interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect traffic data from the Statewide TMC system using the Statewide TMC interface.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect work zone (lane closure) data.
The System shall provide the capability to operate in a Degraded System Mode, within which the system generates a subset of products based upon priority and availability of system resources.
The System shall provide the capability to send an electronic notification to authorized users when they receive restricted access data.
The System shall be capable of defining Data Products for Ingest.
The System shall be capable of rendering Mercator projections.
Allows resources to be reviewed before a decision is made whether they should be retained.
Allows notification of producers and donors about rejected content.
Prompts a request for resubmission to the Content Originator if an error of transmission or receipt occurs
Transmission problems allow rejection of entire packages.
Maintains log of messages sent concerning resubmissions.
Validates automatically the successful transfer of the SIP to a staging area using Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRCs) or checksums associated with each data file.
Allows NLM staff to display and perform manual/visual quality control assurance on staged SIPs via a user-friendly GUI interface.
Stores the identification information in the Data Management database to support search and retrieval of AIPs in Archive Storage.
Moves and adds AIPs to storage within the repository
Maintains the integrity of the Data Management database which contains both metadata and system information.
Audits submissions to ensure that they meet archive/repository standards.
Able to add and edit terms of agreement, based on access of level of user.
Maintains integrity of system configuration.
Audits system operations, performance and usage.
Sends requests for system information to Data Management and receives reports.
Summarizes reports and provides repository performance information and repository holdings inventory reports to Preservation Planning.
Develops and implements plans for system evolution.
Updates contents of DIPs and resubmits them as SIPs to Ingest.
An actor in the role of course administrator should be able to optionally upload multiple files where he or she finds.
Actors in the capacity of course administrator or professor should be able to enable multiple file uploads on a page of his or her choosing.
Actors in the role of professor or system administrator should be allowed to partition this space for actors in the roles of students.
When the actor clicks a search result link, they should be taken to the page corresponding to the search result.
Actors should be able to search from any page.
The system should maintain a grade history.
The system should maintain a history of grades for a particular assignment if the course administrator changes them.
This system is in line with the objectives of the CWM Information Technology initiative presented to the Governing Board in June 2002.
Create heat map indicating who was over-pumping, who was not over-pumping, or who was using their water credits.
Need to know how water use changes when land use changes.
The Black Start unit must be capable of starting and energizing the applicable transmission path without assistance from the electrical system.
The Black Start Test should include key operating aids used in Black Starts such as telephone communications and SCADA, if applicable.
The CAISO maintains a Black Start database that contains all Black Start generators designated for use during a system restoration.
Service Registry encapsulates the resource and service information for each CDN.
Peering Agent is used as a conduit by the mediator to establish negotiations with Peering Agent of other peers and to acquire resources from them.
Service Registry: Registers available local resources at the CDN provider and updates them.
The mediator instance obtains resource and access information from the Service Registry and policy information from Policy Repository to establish negotiation.
Service requirements are received from the mediator.
Primary CDN has already acquired sufficient external resources.
User can click on [ view detail ] for more information about a customer.
The professor’s username should allow them access to the appropriate folder and have Read, Write, and Delete privileges.
Users will be able to upload their documents, and eventually transfer them between other users/computers.
A Guest is a person that is not connected to the VUB-network nor logged into the PMS.
The user can change his account information (eg. password, e-mail address,. . . ).
The user has to have a valid account and has to be logged into his account.
A moderator can change the Group Permissions of any group that falls under his jurisdiction.
The user will have access to the Control Panel, from which he will be able to for example edit the user accounts (upgrade, downgrade or delete user accounts).
GOG must provide a way to be run from a command line or a shell script.
Administrator: A member of the Construction Junction staff who can perform any of the Inventory Management functions.

Receiving Associate: A member of the Construction Junction staff who receives donated items at the receiving docks and performs their initial entry into the Inventory Management System and provides donors with their donation receipts.

Customer Service Representative: A member of the Construction Junction staff who works in the customer service desk and performs specific tasks such as constituent and member database management, item returns processing, creating drop-off acquisitions, and others.
Donor: An individual or organization who donates items to the Construction Junction inventory and receives a tax deduction for doing so.
Buyer: A customer who purchases items from the Construction Junction inventory.
Consigner: An individual who donates items to Construction Junction under consignment.
The system should allow Construction Junction staff to view a list of all items that are currently flagged as blastworthy that haven‟t yet been included in an e-Blast.
Customer Wish List – Provide users with the ability to notify Construction Junction of items that they would like to purchase and be notified when/if those items become available.
The system shall provide an online, hierarchical, and cross-linked help system in HTML that describes and illustrates all system functions.
The system shall provide thorough high-level error reporting and feedback and shall allow low-level query-specific feedback for Local and Global System Administrators from the front-end interface.
Management Processes are part of an enterprise-level Library Automation System.
System Administration support the needs of a large, multiple-branch library system.
Ability to set thresholds on the length of time records are locked and provide, for all record types, a list of records in sustained use/locked condition.
System provides a single console with access to all configuration files.
Staff can be given permission to schedule tasks, reports, and data exports.
System administrators can create report templates that are available to front-line staff, and can be run as is or modified to the staff person's particular needs.
Ability to define and select four types of printers: receipt printer, standard printer, label printer, and forms printer.
A second group of users consists of scientists at RAL (and also outside of RAL), who will be using the system for running model jobs for research purposes.
User can choose to receive email notification upon start, end and termination of the job.
User sorts the search results by clicking once on a column header – system sorts all results by descending/ascending order.
The system shall log errors, warnings, and informational messages to an external log file on the application server.
The system shall provide searching ability to the users to quickly find specific topic material through the online help tool.
The ELSS must provide facilities to capture and deliver for transmission corrections to previously successfully transmitted data.
A product supplier will be provided with the opportunity to publish details of their ELSS Approved product on the ELSS Approved Product Register on the UK Fisheries public website.
The system shall include digital programmable thermostats, which shall be used to monitor and regulate the temperature of an enclosed space.
A DH user shall be able to read the temperature at a thermostat position.
The thermostats may be controlled individually or collectively, so that temperature can be controlled at different levels in different home spaces.
The system allows for the backup of the data system to local or remote non-volatile storage systems.
Users can combine multiple pdf documents in a single pdf document through a user friendly graphical interface with simple utilities.
Systems supporting OM should have the ability to produce pre-formatted queries and reports to allow faster and more accurate reporting, while still allowing the flexibility of ad-hoc reporting.

SwRI shall provide APAF system maintenance.

Ability to create/add a new domain of privacy policies (e.g, Healthcare, financial, e-commerce, federal agency, etc.)
The Clarus system data definitions shall be consistent with the ITE TM 1.03 standard, Functional Level Traffic Management Data Dictionary (TMDD).
The application should be coloured so that the screen shots can be printed out clearly (i.e., black on white background).

The system shall provide a contractual agreement with an internet service provider for T3 access with 99.9999% availability.
The system shall provide a contractual agreement with an internet service provider who can provide 99.999% availability through their network facilities onto the internet.
